summary: This is an email chain from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reporting the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It details that he was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, with signs of a makeshift noose and neck bruising, and was later pronounced dead at a hospital.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive and later pronounced dead in his cell at MCC New York.

persons.name: Shirley V. Skipper-Scott
persons.context: The MCC New York official who authored and forwarded the email reporting Epstein's death.

connections.description: Skipper-Scott, as Associate Warden, was responsible for reporting on the status and incident involving inmate Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York, was transported to a hospital, and pronounced dead. Staff reported finding an orange makeshift noose and neck bruising.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on the morning of August 10, 2019.
An orange makeshift noose was found in his cell, and he had circumfricial bruising around his neck.
He was pronounced dead at a local hospital at 7:36 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
The incident was reported by Associate Warden Shirley V. Skipper-Scott via email on the same day.
